meanings.definition: Give (someone) the authority or power to do something.
meanings.sent1: She empowered her team to make decisions on their own.
meanings.sent2: The mentor empowered the young entrepreneur to take charge of her business.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand empowered the fairy to grant wishes.
meanings.sent4: Education is the key that empowers individuals to shape their future.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape symbolized the empowering ability to make a difference in the world.

meanings.definition: Make (someone) stronger and more confident, especially in controlling their life and claiming their rights.
meanings.sent1: Regular exercise can empower you to overcome challenges.
meanings.sent2: The supportive community empowered her to speak up for herself.
meanings.sent3: The lucky charm seemed to empower him with extra courage.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a shield, empowering him to stand up for what he believed in.
meanings.sent5: The motivational speech was so empowering that it ignited a fire within her to pursue her dreams.
